action.action-desc: Mr. Pfluger (for himself, Mr. Newhouse, Mr. Cuellar, and Mr. Vicente Gonzalez of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Energy Act of 2020 to alter the criteria for the designation of critical minerals.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Critical Minerals Classification Improvement Act of 2022.

section.header: Amendment to definition of critical mineral remove exclusion of fuel minerals

subsection.text: Section 7002(a)(3)(B) of the Energy Act of 2020 (30 U.S.C. 1606(a)(3)(B)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by redesignating clauses (ii) and (iii) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively.

subsection.text: Section 7002(a)(3)(B)(i) of the Energy Act of 2020 (30 U.S.C. 1606(a)(3)(B)), as redesignated, is amended by inserting or after the semicolon.

The Director of the United States Geological Survey shall, not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, make such revisions to the final list of critical minerals included in the notice entitled 2022 Final List of Critical Minerals published by the United States Geological Survey (87 Fed. Reg. 10381; February 24, 2022) as the Director determines are necessary consistent with the amendments made by this section.
